body.p:
Bedford Ky Oct 13 1863
H H Rodman
Dear Friend

Once more I will have to call upon you to do me a favor. My brother in Law Levi S Baker was at the October Term of our court fined fifty dollars for carrying a pistol. Now I want you to hand to the Gov of Kentucky the within petition to have the fine remitted. If you are on good terms with the Governor, I would like for you to make a representation of facts for me. The circumstances in the case were about these, a man by the name of Abbott liveing close to Baker had fallen out with all the family of Baker and said ^used^ some slanderous language in reference to Bakers mother. Baker determined to make him take it Back or thrash him, he was told that he had better prepare himself before he said anything to Abbott. He saw Abbott passing through his Baker,s field. and asked him about it, and Abbott drew a hatchet and Baker shot at him but missed ^him^ and Abbott run. The parties who signed his petition know all about the facts in the case and fully Justify him. he was tried and acquitted for the shooting. he is poor and unable to pay the fine without a sacrifice. Now if you can conscienciously do any thing for him you will confer a favor on your old friend. My family are all well. Mr Samuels I am sorry to say is being verry low. I am afraid will not live but a short time. no news here

Oct 19th Since writing the within I regret to inform you that Mr Samuels has died he died Saturday the 17th Aunt Liz is now confined to bed and is Quite sick. Give my best respects to cousin Sue and receive for yourself the kind regards of your old friend

Trimble Cir Court
vs
Levi S. Baker
$50 --
Respited 12 mos
30th Oct/ 63
carrying concealed weapons
